InformationalUrl.description: Represents a group of URIs that provide terms of service, marketing, support and privacy policy information about an application. The default value for each string is null.

OAuth2Permission.description: Represents an OAuth 2.0 delegated permission scope. The specified OAuth 2.0 delegated permission scopes may be requested by client applications (through the requiredResourceAccess collection on the Application object) when calling a resource application. The oauth2Permissions property of the ServicePrincipal entity and of the Application entity is a collection of OAuth2Permission.

adminConsentDescription.description: Permission help text that appears in the admin consent and app assignment experiences.

adminConsentDisplayName.description: Display name for the permission that appears in the admin consent and app assignment experiences.

id.description: Unique scope permission identifier inside the oauth2Permissions collection.

isEnabled.description: When creating or updating a permission, this property must be set to true (which is the default). To delete a permission, this property must first be set to false. At that point, in a subsequent call, the permission may be removed.

type.description: Specifies whether this scope permission can be consented to by an end user, or whether it is a tenant-wide permission that must be consented to by a Company Administrator. Possible values are "User" or "Admin".

userConsentDescription.description: Permission help text that appears in the end user consent experience.

userConsentDisplayName.description: Display name for the permission that appears in the end user consent experience.

value.description: The value of the scope claim that the resource application should expect in the OAuth 2.0 access token.

OptionalClaims.description: Specifying the claims to be included in the token.

idToken.description: Optional claims requested to be included in the id token.

accessToken.description: Optional claims requested to be included in the access token.

samlToken.description: Optional claims requested to be included in the saml token.

OptionalClaim.description: Specifying the claims to be included in a token.

PreAuthorizedApplication.description: Contains information about pre authorized client application.

permissions.description: Collection of required app permissions/entitlements from the resource application.

extensions.description: Collection of extensions from the resource application.

PreAuthorizedApplicationPermission.description: Contains information about the pre-authorized permissions.

directAccessGrant.description: Indicates whether the permission set is DirectAccess or impersonation.

PreAuthorizedApplicationExtension.description: Representation of an app PreAuthorizedApplicationExtension required by a pre authorized client app.

deletionTimestamp.description: The time at which the directory object was deleted.

DirectoryObject.description: Represents an Azure Active Directory object.

resourceAccess.description: The list of OAuth2.0 permission scopes and app roles that the application requires from the specified resource.

resourceAppId.description: The unique identifier for the resource that the application requires access to. This should be equal to the appId declared on the target resource application.

RequiredResourceAccess.description: Specifies the set of OAuth 2.0 permission scopes and app roles under the specified resource that an application requires access to. The specified OAuth 2.0 permission scopes may be requested by client applications (through the requiredResourceAccess collection) when calling a resource application. The requiredResourceAccess property of the Application entity is a collection of RequiredResourceAccess.

id.description: The unique identifier for one of the OAuth2Permission or AppRole instances that the resource application exposes.

type.description: Specifies whether the id property references an OAuth2Permission or an AppRole. Possible values are "scope" or "role".

ResourceAccess.description: Specifies an OAuth 2.0 permission scope or an app role that an application requires. The resourceAccess property of the RequiredResourceAccess type is a collection of ResourceAccess.

GroupMembershipClaims.description: Configures the groups claim issued in a user or OAuth 2.0 access token that the app expects.

ApplicationBase.description: Active Directive Application common properties shared among GET, POST and PATCH

allowGuestsSignIn.description: A property on the application to indicate if the application accepts other IDPs or not or partially accepts.

allowPassthroughUsers.description: Indicates that the application supports pass through users who have no presence in the resource tenant.

appLogoUrl.description: The url for the application logo image stored in a CDN.

appRoles.description: The collection of application roles that an application may declare. These roles can be assigned to users, groups or service principals.

availableToOtherTenants.description: Whether the application is available to other tenants.

errorUrl.description: A URL provided by the author of the application to report errors when using the application.

groupMembershipClaims.description: Configures the groups claim issued in a user or OAuth 2.0 access token that the app expects.

homepage.description: The home page of the application.

informationalUrls.description: URLs with more information about the application.

isDeviceOnlyAuthSupported.description: Specifies whether this application supports device authentication without a user. The default is false.

knownClientApplications.description: Client applications that are tied to this resource application. Consent to any of the known client applications will result in implicit consent to the resource application through a combined consent dialog (showing the OAuth permission scopes required by the client and the resource).

logoutUrl.description: the url of the logout page

oauth2AllowImplicitFlow.description: Whether to allow implicit grant flow for OAuth2

oauth2AllowUrlPathMatching.description: Specifies whether during a token Request Azure AD will allow path matching of the redirect URI against the applications collection of replyURLs. The default is false.

oauth2Permissions.description: The collection of OAuth 2.0 permission scopes that the web API (resource) application exposes to client applications. These permission scopes may be granted to client applications during consent.

oauth2RequirePostResponse.description: Specifies whether, as part of OAuth 2.0 token requests, Azure AD will allow POST requests, as opposed to GET requests. The default is false, which specifies that only GET requests will be allowed.

orgRestrictions.description: A list of tenants allowed to access application.

publicClient.description: Specifies whether this application is a public client (such as an installed application running on a mobile device). Default is false.

publisherDomain.description: Reliable domain which can be used to identify an application.

replyUrls.description: A collection of reply URLs for the application.

requiredResourceAccess.description: Specifies resources that this application requires access to and the set of OAuth permission scopes and application roles that it needs under each of those resources. This pre-configuration of required resource access drives the consent experience.

samlMetadataUrl.description: The URL to the SAML metadata for the application.

signInAudience.description: Audience for signing in to the application (AzureADMyOrganization, AzureADAllOrganizations, AzureADAndMicrosoftAccounts).

displayName.description: The display name of the application.

identifierUris.description: A collection of URIs for the application.

ApplicationCreateParameters.description: Request parameters for creating a new application.

ApplicationUpdateParameters.description: Request parameters for updating a new application.

displayName.description: The display name of the application.

allowGuestsSignIn.description: A property on the application to indicate if the application accepts other IDPs or not or partially accepts.

appRoles.description: The collection of application roles that an application may declare. These roles can be assigned to users, groups or service principals.

errorUrl.description: A URL provided by the author of the application to report errors when using the application.

informationalUrls.description: URLs with more information about the application.

isDeviceOnlyAuthSupported.description: Specifies whether this application supports device authentication without a user. The default is false.

knownClientApplications.description: Client applications that are tied to this resource application. Consent to any of the known client applications will result in implicit consent to the resource application through a combined consent dialog (showing the OAuth permission scopes required by the client and the resource).

logoutUrl.description: the url of the logout page

oauth2AllowImplicitFlow.description: Whether to allow implicit grant flow for OAuth2

oauth2AllowUrlPathMatching.description: Specifies whether during a token Request Azure AD will allow path matching of the redirect URI against the applications collection of replyURLs. The default is false.

oauth2Permissions.description: The collection of OAuth 2.0 permission scopes that the web API (resource) application exposes to client applications. These permission scopes may be granted to client applications during consent.

oauth2RequirePostResponse.description: Specifies whether, as part of OAuth 2.0 token requests, Azure AD will allow POST requests, as opposed to GET requests. The default is false, which specifies that only GET requests will be allowed.

orgRestrictions.description: A list of tenants allowed to access application.

publicClient.description: Specifies whether this application is a public client (such as an installed application running on a mobile device). Default is false.

publisherDomain.description: Reliable domain which can be used to identify an application.

replyUrls.description: A collection of reply URLs for the application.

requiredResourceAccess.description: Specifies resources that this application requires access to and the set of OAuth permission scopes and application roles that it needs under each of those resources. This pre-configuration of required resource access drives the consent experience.

samlMetadataUrl.description: The URL to the SAML metadata for the application.

signInAudience.description: Audience for signing in to the application (AzureADMyOrganization, AzureADAllOrganizations, AzureADAndMicrosoftAccounts).

odata.nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

value.description: The Object ID of the service principal with the specified application ID.

id.description: Unique role identifier inside the appRoles collection.

allowedMemberTypes.description: Specifies whether this app role definition can be assigned to users and groups by setting to 'User', or to other applications (that are accessing this application in daemon service scenarios) by setting to 'Application', or to both.

description.description: Permission help text that appears in the admin app assignment and consent experiences.

displayName.description: Display name for the permission that appears in the admin consent and app assignment experiences.

isEnabled.description: When creating or updating a role definition, this must be set to true (which is the default). To delete a role, this must first be set to false. At that point, in a subsequent call, this role may be removed.

value.description: Specifies the value of the roles claim that the application should expect in the authentication and access tokens.

url.description: A owner object URL, such as "https://graph.windows.net/0b1f9851-1bf0-433f-aec3-cb9272f093dc/directoryObjects/f260bbc4-c254-447b-94cf-293b5ec434dd", where "0b1f9851-1bf0-433f-aec3-cb9272f093dc" is the tenantId and "f260bbc4-c254-447b-94cf-293b5ec434dd" is the objectId of the owner (user, application, servicePrincipal, group) to be added.

AddOwnerParameters.description: Request parameters for adding a owner to an application.

odata.nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

id.description: The role id that was assigned to the principal. This role must be declared by the target resource application resourceId in its appRoles property.

principalDisplayName.description: The display name of the principal that was granted the access.

principalId.description: The unique identifier (objectId) for the principal being granted the access.

principalType.description: The type of principal. This can either be "User", "Group" or "ServicePrincipal".

resourceDisplayName.description: The display name of the resource to which the assignment was made.

resourceId.description: The unique identifier (objectId) for the target resource (service principal) for which the assignment was made.

odata.nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

KeyCredentialsUpdateParameters.description: Request parameters for a KeyCredentials update operation

PasswordCredentialsUpdateParameters.description: Request parameters for a PasswordCredentials update operation.

url.description: A member object URL, such as "https://graph.windows.net/0b1f9851-1bf0-433f-aec3-cb9272f093dc/directoryObjects/f260bbc4-c254-447b-94cf-293b5ec434dd", where "0b1f9851-1bf0-433f-aec3-cb9272f093dc" is the tenantId and "f260bbc4-c254-447b-94cf-293b5ec434dd" is the objectId of the member (user, application, servicePrincipal, group) to be added.

GroupAddMemberParameters.description: Request parameters for adding a member to a group.

mailEnabled.description: Whether the group is mail-enabled. Must be false. This is because only pure security groups can be created using the Graph API.

securityEnabled.description: Whether the group is a security group. Must be true. This is because only pure security groups can be created using the Graph API.

GroupCreateParameters.description: Request parameters for creating a new group.

displayName.description: The display name of the group.

mailEnabled.description: Whether the group is mail-enabled. Must be false. This is because only pure security groups can be created using the Graph API.

mailNickname.description: The mail alias for the group.

mail.description: The primary email address of the group.

value.description: A collection of Active Directory groups.

odata.nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

GroupListResult.description: Server response for Get tenant groups API call

securityEnabledOnly.description: If true, only membership in security-enabled groups should be checked. Otherwise, membership in all groups should be checked.

GroupGetMemberGroupsParameters.description: Request parameters for GetMemberGroups API call.

value.description: A collection of group IDs of which the group is a member.

GroupGetMemberGroupsResult.description: Server response for GetMemberGroups API call.

groupId.description: The object ID of the group to check.

memberId.description: The object ID of the contact, group, user, or service principal to check for membership in the specified group.

CheckGroupMembershipParameters.description: Request parameters for IsMemberOf API call.

value.description: True if the specified user, group, contact, or service principal has either direct or transitive membership in the specified group; otherwise, false.

CheckGroupMembershipResult.description: Server response for IsMemberOf API call

ServicePrincipalBase.description: Active Directory service principal common properties shared among GET, POST and PATCH

accountEnabled.description: whether or not the service principal account is enabled

appRoleAssignmentRequired.description: Specifies whether an AppRoleAssignment to a user or group is required before Azure AD will issue a user or access token to the application.

keyCredentials.description: The collection of key credentials associated with the service principal.

passwordCredentials.description: The collection of password credentials associated with the service principal.

servicePrincipalType.description: the type of the service principal

tags.description: Optional list of tags that you can apply to your service principals. Not nullable.

ServicePrincipalCreateParameters.description: Request parameters for creating a new service principal.

ServicePrincipalUpdateParameters.description: Request parameters for update an existing service principal.

accountEnabled.description: whether or not the service principal account is enabled

appDisplayName.description: The display name exposed by the associated application.

appRoleAssignmentRequired.description: Specifies whether an AppRoleAssignment to a user or group is required before Azure AD will issue a user or access token to the application.

appRoles.description: The collection of application roles that an application may declare. These roles can be assigned to users, groups or service principals.

displayName.description: The display name of the service principal.

errorUrl.description: A URL provided by the author of the associated application to report errors when using the application.

homepage.description: The URL to the homepage of the associated application.

keyCredentials.description: The collection of key credentials associated with the service principal.

logoutUrl.description: A URL provided by the author of the associated application to logout

oauth2Permissions.description: The OAuth 2.0 permissions exposed by the associated application.

passwordCredentials.description: The collection of password credentials associated with the service principal.

preferredTokenSigningKeyThumbprint.description: The thumbprint of preferred certificate to sign the token

publisherName.description: The publisher's name of the associated application

replyUrls.description: The URLs that user tokens are sent to for sign in with the associated application.  The redirect URIs that the oAuth 2.0 authorization code and access tokens are sent to for the associated application.

samlMetadataUrl.description: The URL to the SAML metadata of the associated application

servicePrincipalNames.description: A collection of service principal names.

servicePrincipalType.description: the type of the service principal

tags.description: Optional list of tags that you can apply to your service principals. Not nullable.

odata.nextLink.description: the URL to get the next set of results.

ServicePrincipalListResult.description: Server response for get tenant service principals API call.

forceChangePasswordNextLogin.description: Whether to force a password change on next login.

PasswordProfile.description: The password profile associated with a user.

immutableId.description: This must be specified if you are using a federated domain for the user's userPrincipalName (UPN) property when creating a new user account. It is used to associate an on-premises Active Directory user account with their Azure AD user object.

usageLocation.description: A two letter country code (ISO standard 3166). Required for users that will be assigned licenses due to legal requirement to check for availability of services in countries. Examples include: "US", "JP", and "GB".

givenName.description: The given name for the user.

surname.description: The user's surname (family name or last name).

userType.description: A string value that can be used to classify user types in your directory, such as 'Member' and 'Guest'.

displayName.description: The display name of the user.

userPrincipalName.description: The user principal name (someuser@contoso.com). It must contain one of the verified domains for the tenant.

mailNickname.description: The mail alias for the user.

mail.description: The primary email address of the user.

UserCreateParameters.description: Request parameters for creating a new work or school account user.

displayName.description: The display name of the user.

passwordProfile.description: The password profile of the user.

userPrincipalName.description: The user principal name (someuser@contoso.com). It must contain one of the verified domains for the tenant.

mailNickname.description: The mail alias for the user.

UserUpdateParameters.description: Request parameters for updating an existing work or school account user.

immutableId.description: This must be specified if you are using a federated domain for the user's userPrincipalName (UPN) property when creating a new user account. It is used to associate an on-premises Active Directory user account with their Azure AD user object.

usageLocation.description: A two letter country code (ISO standard 3166). Required for users that will be assigned licenses due to legal requirement to check for availability of services in countries. Examples include: "US", "JP", and "GB".

givenName.description: The given name for the user.

surname.description: The user's surname (family name or last name).

userType.description: A string value that can be used to classify user types in your directory, such as 'Member' and 'Guest'.

displayName.description: The display name of the user.

userPrincipalName.description: The principal name of the user.

mailNickname.description: The mail alias for the user.

mail.description: The primary email address of the user.

signInNames.description: The sign-in names of the user.

type.description: A string value that can be used to classify user sign-in types in your directory, such as 'emailAddress' or 'userName'.

value.description: The sign-in used by the local account. Must be unique across the company/tenant. For example, 'johnc@example.com'.

SignInName.description: Contains information about a sign-in name of a local account user in an Azure Active Directory B2C tenant.

securityEnabledOnly.description: If true, only membership in security-enabled groups should be checked. Otherwise, membership in all groups should be checked.

UserGetMemberGroupsParameters.description: Request parameters for GetMemberGroups API call.

value.description: A collection of group IDs of which the user is a member.

UserGetMemberGroupsResult.description: Server response for GetMemberGroups API call.

odata.nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

UserListResult.description: Server response for Get tenant users API call.

includeDirectoryObjectReferences.description: If true, also searches for object IDs in the partner tenant.

GetObjectsParameters.description: Request parameters for the GetObjectsByObjectIds API.

authenticationType.description: the type of the authentication into the domain.

isDefault.description: if this is the default domain in the tenant.

isVerified.description: if this domain's ownership is verified.

DomainListResult.description: Server response for Get tenant domains API call.

clientId.description: The id of the resource's service principal granted consent to impersonate the user when accessing the resource (represented by the resourceId property).

objectId.description: The id of the permission grant

consentType.description: Indicates if consent was provided by the administrator (on behalf of the organization) or by an individual.

principalId.description: When consent type is Principal, this property specifies the id of the user that granted consent and applies only for that user.

resourceId.description: Object Id of the resource you want to grant

scope.description: Specifies the value of the scope claim that the resource application should expect in the OAuth 2.0 access token. For example, User.Read

value.description: the list of oauth2 permissions grants

odata.nextLink.description: the URL to get the next set of results.

OAuth2PermissionGrantListResult.description: Server response for get oauth2 permissions grants
